intro: Apinagia, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in mountainous areas. The plants are evergreen shrubs characterized by their dense, leathery leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Apinagia species often thrive in acidic soils and are adapted to harsh alpine environments. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
